paging.algorithms

Class BasePagingAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • paging.algorithms.BasePagingAlgorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LFU, LRU

    public abstract class BasePagingAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object

    Abstract class for all paging algorithms

    See Also:
    LRU

    • Field Detail

      • memoryQueue

        Frame[] memoryQueue

        Memory in which frames are stored while they are being processed.

      • referenceList

        java.util.List<Frame> referenceList

        Reference page list which will be used to create frames.

        Pages are equal to frames in this particular example.

      • pathToSourceFile

        java.lang.String pathToSourceFile

        Path to source file in which pages are stored

        int amnt

        Amount of pages used.

    • Method Detail

      • executePages

        protected abstract void executePages()
        Abstract method that simulates execution of paging.

      • createPages

        protected void createPages()

        Creates pages using data from file "pages*.csv" and put them to reference list.

        Method reads each line of specified file under pathToSourceFile and puts it into referenceList.
        First column is id of page.

      • setPageFaults

        protected void setPageFaults(double amntPageFault,
                             boolean... isUnderTest)
        Sets amount of page faults for specific algorithm.
        Parameters:
        amntPageFault - is equal to amount of page faults
        isUnderTest - is set to true if method is used in tests. As default it is false.

      • getPageFault

        public double getPageFault()
        Gets amount of page faults.
        Returns:
        the value under the amntPageFault variable

      • getIndexInArray

        public int getIndexInArray(Frame[] array,
                           Frame frame)
        Gets index of specified Frame from memoryQueue
        Parameters:
        array - memoryQueue
        frame - specified frame
        Returns:
        index of frame in memoryQueue

      • setOthersAge

        protected Frame[] setOthersAge(int memoryListIndex,
                               Frame[] memoryQueue)
        Sets age of elements in memory array on indexes that are not equal to given one.
        Parameters:
        memoryListIndex - index of element that we don't want to be changed
        memoryQueue - array of frames in memory
        Returns:
        fixed array of frames in memory

      • getLeastRecentlyUsed

        protected int getLeastRecentlyUsed(Frame[] array,
                                   int size)
        Gets index of element which was least recently used
        Parameters:
        array - array of frames in memory
        size - size of array
        Returns:
        index of element that was leas recently used
